body: The `printf()`seems to be getting dropped in this suggestion.
Again, the `printf()` call is getting dropped in this suggestion.

- statement should be inside braces [[readability-braces-around-statements](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/readability/braces-around-statements.html)]

```suggestion
        break;
```

```suggestion
}
```

<!-- cpp linter action -->
### clang-tidy diagnostics
- use default member initializer for 'useless' [[modernize-use-default-member-init](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize/use-default-member-init.html)]
- use default member initializer for 'numb' [[modernize-use-default-member-init](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize/use-default-member-init.html)]

```suggestion
    char* useless { "\0" };
    int numb { 0 };
    Dummy() { }
```

<!-- cpp linter action -->
### clang-tidy diagnostics

```suggestion
public:
    auto not_useful(char* str) -> void* { useless = str; }
```
More detail please! Which line(s)?

clang-tidy diagnostic isn't named here
> src/demo.cpp:3:10: warning: [[modernize-deprecated-headers](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize/deprecated-headers.html)]

Try to find out why and fix it.

This change is from code style guidelines (a clang-format thing), thus no clang-tidy diagnostic to name as the cause for the change.

We should probably change the wording in this situation:
```diff
-clang-tidy diagnostics
+clang-tidy suggestions
```
Again wording seems inadequate here because no clang-tidy diagnostics are named for code style guidelines.
